discussion.content: I think A should be correct. But as for D, the keywords are "administration of accounts for authorized users to access the appropriate data." It's not about account management. It is about determining who can access what.

D is the correct answer
Source: https://ori.hhs.gov/education/products/n_illinois_u/datamanagement/dotopic.html

comments.content: I chose as well. D sounds more like a account management policy. A does not sound a whole lot better as well to be honest. Stupid and vague answers

discussion.content: Not really convinced that this is D. A could be an answer also.

choices.C: The policy should document practices that users must adhere to in order to access data on the corporate network or Internet.
choices.A: The policy should describe the roles and responsibilities between users and managers, and the management of specific data types.
choices.D: The policy should outline the organization's administration of accounts for authorized users to access the appropriate data.
choices.B: The policy should establish the protocol for retaining information types based on regulatory or business needs.

questions.question_text: Which of the following policies BEST explains the purpose of a data ownership policy?

comments.content: This commend made me create an account here... I hope I won't get these types of questions on my exam tomorrow.

discussion.content:
Question is best method to discover the vulnerability before a production deployment

A. Manual peer review - focuses on peer review of the code during development
B. User acceptance testing - focuses on functionalities during user testing
C. Input validation - this does not discovers vulnerability. this is a method to prevent vulnerabilities/exploits related to injection
D. Stress test the application - focuses on the max load the application can handle

Question and answers are shitty
I would think a peer would catch an oversight like leaving default usernames and passwords in place. I made an account just to say i agree with s3curity1

I would also suggest A. Manual peer review. 
UAT is about function
C is not related to authentication / prevents vulners..
D is about app load.

Would say A
Manual peer review could highlight the use of admin id and grant of elevated privileges
Sorry but this can't be C. Input validation has nothing to do with discovering vulnerabilities... .

questions.question_text: A web application has a newly discovered vulnerability in the authentication method used to validate known company users. The user ID of Admin with a password of "password" grants elevated access to the application over the Internet. Which of the following is the BEST method to discover the vulnerability before a production deployment?
